comment.author: 76597886@N00
comment._content:
From the NY Times archive:

DYNAMITE BLAST KILLS FOUR IN PARK; Six Others Injured at the Bottom of a Shaft by a Stick Left There on Saturday.
October 10, 1911, Tuesday

Four men were killed and six others injured yesterday morning when a pneumatic drill in a sixty-foot shaft that is being sunk in West Drive, Central Park, struck a stick of dynamite that was thought to have been exploded last Saturday night when the charges in ten holes at the bottom of the shaft were set off.
